message.content:
cs.CY, cs.IR, cs.MM, cs.CL, cs.CR 

This paper deals with the problem of detecting inappropriate content on YouTube, which involves analyzing video content and developing a classifier to identify disturbing videos. This falls under the category of computational methods for analyzing multimedia content (cs.MM), as well as information retrieval (cs.IR) and natural language processing (cs.CL) for analyzing video titles and descriptions. Additionally, the paper discusses the limitations of YouTube's current counter-measures, which could be considered a form of cybersecurity (cs.CR). Finally, the paper addresses the issue of child safety online, which could be classified under the sub-category of computer and society (cs.CY).
